questions.question: When using the One-Click Deploy option, which component is deployed first by the system?

explanations.a: Incorrect. NRF is deployed after the Service Bus.
explanations.b: Incorrect. AMF is not the first component.
explanations.c: Correct. The Service Bus is deployed first during automatic deployment.
explanations.d: Incorrect. UPF is deployed later in the sequence.

questions.question: What happens to the existing topology when One-Click Deploy is initiated?

answers.a: It is merged with the new topology

explanations.a: Incorrect. Existing topology is not merged.
explanations.b: Incorrect. No backup operation is mentioned.
explanations.c: Correct. The system clears any existing topology automatically.
explanations.d: Incorrect. The topology does not remain unchanged.

questions.question: Which action allows you to view the registration request sent by an AMF to the NRF?

answers.c: Click 'Show Registration Message' in the AMF Configuration Panel

explanations.b: Incorrect. Restarting does not display messages.
explanations.c: Correct. The registration message is viewed from the Configuration Panel.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Service Bus logs are unrelated.

questions.question: In what format are the registration and deregistration messages displayed?

explanations.d: Correct. All messages are displayed in JSON format.

questions.question: Which Network Function is responsible for maintaining registration information of all NFs?

explanations.b: Correct. NRF manages NF registration and discovery.

questions.question: How can registration details from all Network Functions be viewed collectively?

explanations.a: Incorrect. This shows only individual NF details.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Service Bus does not aggregate registrations.
explanations.c: Correct. NRF displays registration requests from all NFs.
explanations.d: Incorrect. UE does not manage registrations.

questions.question: What is the correct procedure to deregister an SMF from the NRF?

answers.c: Click 'Deregister from NRF' in the SMF Configuration Panel

explanations.a: Incorrect. NRF does not need to be stopped.
explanations.c: Correct. Deregistration is performed via the Configuration Panel.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Restarting does not deregister the NF.

questions.question: After deregistration, where can the deregistration request be viewed from the NF side?

answers.b: NF Configuration Panel using 'Show Deregistration Message'

explanations.a: Incorrect. This shows NRF perspective only.
explanations.b: Correct. NF side messages are viewed from its Configuration Panel.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Service Bus logs are not used here.

questions.question: What information does the NRF display when an NF deregisters?

answers.c: Which NF requested deregistration and related details

explanations.b: Incorrect. Details include more than just the name.
explanations.c: Correct. NRF shows the NF identity and deregistration details.

questions.question: What is the impact of NF deregistration on discovery results?

answers.c: The deregistered NF is excluded from discovery responses
answers.d: All NFs are removed from discovery

explanations.a: Incorrect. Deregistered NFs are not returned.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Discovery continues for other NFs.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Only the deregistered NF is affected.

questions.question: Which visual behavior confirms automatic deployment is in progress?

answers.c: Network Functions appear one by one in the topology

explanations.c: Correct. NFs appear one by one during deployment.

questions.question: Which button is used to confirm viewing of registration messages?

explanations.b: Incorrect. Start NF does not show messages.
explanations.c: Correct. This button displays registration details.

questions.question: Which of the following Network Functions is included in the automatic deployment list?

explanations.c: Correct. NRF is part of the deployment.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Load Balancer is not mentioned.

questions.question: What confirms that an NF is successfully registered with the NRF?

explanations.a: Correct. Successful registration makes the NF discoverable.

questions.question: Why is NRF verification important during discovery after deregistration?

answers.b: To ensure only active NFs are returned

explanations.a: Incorrect. NRF does not restart NFs.
explanations.b: Correct. NRF ensures only registered and active NFs are discoverable.
explanations.c: Incorrect. UE traffic logging is not the purpose.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Service Bus configuration is unchanged.
